intro: Allotoonia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered allotoonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Allotoonia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
